page.title: 16A LOCAL RIDING SCHOOL
page.content: There is a riding school along the Weedon Rd. in Nether Heyford; it is licensed for lessons & hacks. The house was built in 1979 by a builder from Crick; it was built after the stables . The first horse they bought in 1979 is now 26 years old. The owners like their surroundings and would not like to live anywhere else. They have other animals - rabbits, ducks, a pig and some cattle. In their spare time they show-jump; occasionally they do their own shows. If you go for riding lesson it costs 3.50 for children and 3.75 for adults. For a week's course it is 45 pounds; for a day it is 5 pounds. Their customers come from Daventry, Towcester, Weedon and Flore, as well as from Heyford. N.B. There is another Riding School in Upper Heyford, but it has not been going quite so long.
